wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Gets a document showing the local configuration data for a particular district. This document is a detailed dump of data in the "local" table of the server, and also includes office information from tables circuit_district, office_addr, and divisional_office. See localCircuitDistrictConfiguration.
This method is a duplicate of method getDistrictLocalConfig from Gen3ConfigService, which has been deprecated following the completion of the Gen3 database transition.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: Returns a serviceResponse containing an instance of a localCircuitDistrictConfiguration document.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new chronos to the system. See chronos. Data in the following elements will be ignored: author, chronosContacts-chronosContactCode.

Minimum required elements: attempted, authorCode, chronosContacts, chronosContacts-id-chronosCode, chronosContacts-id-probPts, chronosContacts-createdOn, chronosContacts-createdBy, clientId, confidential, contactDate, noncompliance, planChange, probPts, respNoncompliance, thirdPartyRisk, createdOn, createdBy.

As of Release 1.5, the "chronosContacts-chronosContactCodeId-*" elements are deprecated. If supplied, they will be ignored. The chronosContacts-id-chronosCode is required. Examples can be found on the USPPS Developers wiki.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a chronos xml document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of chronos. The data will reflect the state of the chronos after insertion in the database. It will include the db-assigned identifier.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates a chronos already in the system. See chronos. Data in the following elements will be ignored: author, chronosContacts-chronosContactCode.

Minimum required elements: id and the required elements specified in the POST /chronos service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a chronos xml document. The xml document should include an id value as the chronos should already exist in PACTS.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of chronos xml document. This chronos will reflect the state of chronos after database update.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
A ChronosCollection resource is a Set of Chronos documents that are to be stored in the pacts database. This method stores the chronos in the list one-by-one and returns as a result the last chronos inserted. See chronosCollection. Data in the following elements will be ignored: author,chronosContacts-chronosContactCode.

For minimum required elements, please see POST /chronos service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: A simple collection type that holds a list of chronos documents. Each list member is a chronos that complies with the chronos schema.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of chronos document for the last chronos inserted. This document will reflect the state of chronos after database update.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates a list of chronos stored in the pacts database. This method assumes that we are updating each chronos in the list. This method stores the chronos in the list one-by-one and returns as a result the last chronos updated. See chronosCollection. Data in the following elements will be ignored: author, chronosContacts-chronosContactCode.

Minimum required elements: id and the required elements specified in the POST /chronoscollection service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: A simple collection type that holds a list of chronos documents. Each list member is a chronos that complies with the chronos schema. The assumption here is that these documents already exist in the system and are to be updated.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of chronos xml document for the last chronos updated.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Inserts a chronos contact into the database. See chronosContact.

Minimum required elements: id-chronos, id-chronosCode, id-probPts, createdOn, createdBy

wadl:request.wadl:doc: Contact record. The data should include a chronos id for the chronos to which this contact is attached as well as the contact code identifying the type of contact.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the last contact record inserted.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates a chronos contact. See chronosContact.

Minimum required elements: id and required elements listed in the POST /chronoscontact service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: Contact record. The data should include a chronos id for the chronos to which this contact is attached as well as the contact code identifying the type of contact.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the last contact record inserted.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Inserts a collection of chronos contacts into the database. See chronosContactCollection.

For minimum required elements, see POST /chronoscontact service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: Collection of contact records to be inserted.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: Returns the last contact record inserted as it appears after insertion.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates a collection of chronos contacts into the database. See chronosContactCollection.

Minimum required elements: id and required elements specified in the POST /chronoscontactcollection service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: Collection of contact records to be inserted.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: Returns the last contact record updated as it appears after update.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of addresses associated with a client. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the client resource was added. See clientAddress, geoAddress, and baseAddress. Main data source (database tables): client_address, address_contact

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of clientAddress instances.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new client address resource. See clientAddress, geoAddress, and baseAddress.

Minimum required elements: address1, createdBy, addressTypeId, clientId, dateFrom.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientAddress XML document. The document should not include a (client address) id value. The id will be assigned automatically. Data in the following elements will be ignored: addressType, county.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientAddress instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing client address resource. See clientAddress, geoAddress, and baseAddress.

Minimum required elements: id and required fields specified in the POST /clientaddress service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientAddress XML document. The document should include the id value of the client address resource to update. Data in the following elements will be ignored: addressType, county.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientAddress instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing client data transfer resource. See clientDataTransfer.

Minimum required elements: id and required elements specified in the POST /clientdatatransfer service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientDataTransfer XML document. The document should include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientDataTransfer instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new client data transfer resource. See clientDataTransfer. The document should include the id value of the resource to update.

Minimum required elements: sendingClientId, transferDate, createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientDataTransfer XML document. The document should NOT include the id value of the resource to update.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientDataTransfer instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new client data transfer history resource. See clientDataTransferHistory.

Minimum required elements: receivingLcdId, transferDate, createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientDataTransferHistory XML document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientDataTransferHistory instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets client data transfer history list based on the receiving district or on the sending district and client id. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the client resource was added. See clientDataTransferHistoryReceiving. Main data source (database tables): client_data_transfer_history.

wadl:param.name: lcdId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Four-character district identifier of the sending district (i.e. the district that initiated the transfer)

wadl:param.name: receivingLcdId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Optional. Four-character identifier of the receiving district.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of clientDataTransferHistoryReceiving instances. If receivingLcdId parameter value is specified, the list is based on the receiving district. Otherwise, it is based on the sending district and (sending) client id.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets client data transfer queue information based on the receiving district or on the sending district and client id. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the client resource, in the transfer queue, was added to the system. See clientDataTransferReceiving. Main data source (database tables): client_data_transfer.

wadl:param.name: lcdId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Four-character district identifier of the sending district (i.e. the district that initiated the transfer)

wadl:param.name: receivingLcdId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Optional. Four-character identifier of the receiving district.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of clientDataTransferReceiving instances. If a receivingLcdId parameter value is specified, the list contains instances based on the receiving district . Otherwise, the list contains instances based on the sending district and (sending) client id.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets client demographics resource(s) based on query parameter values. See clientDemographics and clientBase. Main data source (database tables): client, client_address, alternate_id, alternate_name, identifying_marks, client_vehicle, images.

wadl:param.name: regisMarshNum
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Identification Number assigned to the client by the U.S. Marshal Service or by the Bureau of Prisons.

wadl:param.name: iceNumber
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Immigration & Customs Enforcement Number assigned to the client

wadl:param.name: dateOfBirth
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Date of birth of the client

wadl:param.name: lastName
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Last name or corporation name of client

wadl:param.name: lcdId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Four-character district identifier of the sending district (i.e. the district that initiated the transfer)

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance(s) of clientDemographics matching the criteria provided in the query parameters.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing client demographics resource. See clientDemographics and clientBase.

Minimum required elements: id and required fields specified in the POST /clientdemographics service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientDemographics XML document. The document should include the id value of the client demographics resource to update. Data in the following elements will be ignored: birthCountry, citizenCountry, citizenship, eyeColor, fileOutLoc, hairColor, hispanic, immigrantStat, oldCitizen, pfileOutLoc, preTrialOfficer, probationOfficer, race, secondCountryCitizenship, and sex.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientDemographics instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a client demographics resource. Includes client resource and any associated addresses, alternate ids, alternate names, identifying marks, vehicles and photos).

See clientDemographics.

Minimum required elements: fbiNo, highProfile, isIndividual, lastName, ssn, createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientDemographics XML document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically. Data in the following elements will be ignored: birthCountry, citizenCountry, citizenship, eyeColor, fileOutLoc, hairColor, hispanic, immigrantStat, oldCitizen, pfileOutLoc, preTrialOfficer, probationOfficer, race, secondCountryCitizenship, and sex.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientDemographics instance representing the new resource. The clientDemographics instance includes the id value.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a client's personal information including name, identification numbers, demographics and file information. firstName (optional), middleName (optional), lastName (required), generation (optional) is identifying information found in the client resource. See clientBase. Main data source (database tables): client.

wadl:param.name: lastName
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Client Last Name. Required if id, ssn not provided

wadl:param.name: dropPunctuation
wadl:param.wadl:doc: When set to true, removes ' . - , from search on firstName, middleName, lastName, and generation

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of client/clientBase.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing client resource. See clientBase and client.

Minimum required elements: id and required fields specified in the POST /clientperson service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a client XML document. The document should include the id value of the client resource to update. Data in the following elements will be ignored: birthCountry, citizenCountry, citizenship, eyeColor, fileOutLoc, hairColor, hispanic, immigrantStat, oldCitizen, pfileOutLoc, preTrialOfficer, probationOfficer, race, secondCountryCitizenship, and sex.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a client instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new client resource. See clientBase and client.

Minimum required elements: highProfile, isIndividual, createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a client XML document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically. Data in the following elements will be ignored: birthCountry, citizenCountry, citizenship, eyeColor, fileOutLoc, hairColor, hispanic, immigrantStat, oldCitizen, pfileOutLoc, preTrialOfficer, probationOfficer, race, secondCountryCitizenship, and sex.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a client instance representing the new resource. The client instance includes the id value.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a client profile resource based on the client id and snapshot type id. See clientProfile. Main data source (database tables): client_profile, client, ext_cl_profile, mhealth_diag_selec, mhealth_stat_selec, vocation_select.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of clientProfile instances.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing client profile resource. See clientProfile.

Minimum required elements: id and createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a clientProfile XML document. The document should include the id value of the client profile resource to update. Data in the following elements will be ignored: birthCountry, citizenCountry, citizenship, eyeColor, fileOutLoc, hairColor, hispanic, immigrantStat, oldCitizen, pfileOutLoc, preTrialOfficer, probationOfficer, race, secondCountryCitizenship, sex, commuTimeType, languageSkill, primaryLang, snapshotType, subAbuseStatus, educationLevel, healthWellness, and maritalStatus.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a clientProfile instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: This method will create image object in database as well as images binary data on FTP location.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a image XML document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a image instance representing the created resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Updates an existing employment resource. See employment. Main data source (database tables): employment, employer, employ_benes_list. Minimum required elements: id and required fields specified in the POST /employment service.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a employment instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new employment resource. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the employment resource was added. See employment. Main data source (database tables): employment, employer, employ_benes_list.

Required fields are - clientId. The createdBy and createdOn fields are required only for the POST operation.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of employment instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Updates an existing unemployment resource. See unemployment. Main data source (database tables): unemployment. Minimum required elements: id and required fields specified in the POST /unemployment service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a unemployment XML document. The document should include the id value of the unemployment resource to update.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a unemployment instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new unemployment resource. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the unemployment resource was added. See unemployment. Main data source (database tables): unemployment.

Required fields are - clientId, fromDate, excused. The createdBy and createdOn fields are required only for the POST operation.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a unemployment XML document. The document should not include a (unemployment) id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of unemployment instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a client employment resource. The id is an integer assigned by the database when the client resource was added. See clientEmployment. Main data source (database tables): client, employ_summary, employment, employer, employ_benes_list, unemployment.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of clientEmployment

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a client presentence. The id is an integer assigned by the database when a client has a presentence resource. See clientPreSentence Main data source (database tables): client, psi_psr_cases

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of clientPreSentence.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Adds a new criminal history charge resource to the system. See criminalHistoryCharges. Database table: criminal_history_charges

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a criminal history charges instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Updates an existing criminal history charges resource. See criminalHistoryCharges. Database table: criminal_history_charges

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a criminal history detail instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Adds a new criminal history detail resource to the system. See criminalHistoryDetails. Database table: criminal_history_details

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a criminal history detail instance representing the new resource.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Updates an existing criminal history detail resource. See criminalHistoryDetails. Database table: criminal_history_details

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a criminal history detail instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of all judges. Ordered by last name ascending, where alwaysShow=Y. lcdId is required but results may include judges from all districts. Tables: judge, circuit_district

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of judges.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of district names, with ID and abbreviation. See localCircuitDistrictName. Main data source (database tables): local

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of localCircuitDistrictName.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of all office addresses for a given district. Table: office_addr

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of OfficeAddress.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets staff member list for an entire district. See staffBase and staff. Main data source (database tables): staff

wadl:param.name: alwaysShow
wadl:param.wadl:doc: optional single character value for always_show (Y or N). Default Y.

wadl:param.name: currentSupervisorStatus
wadl:param.wadl:doc: optional two character value for supervisor.current_status

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of Staff. Response includes only Staff with alwaysShow=Y if alwaysShow and currentSupervisorStatus are null.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: The Document Upload service provides service consumers the ability to upload document images to PACTS. The Document Upload service accepts multipart/form-data requests and produces an XML service response. This service requires two attachments (named "file" and "properties") that represent the document and metadata, respectively. Click here for more information on the Document Upload service.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Get a single document record by document id, including a base64-encoded copy of the document binary. Confidential documents are not returned by this service. If a confidential document is requested the response will be 404 Not Found. Sealed documents are returned. See documentImage.

Database table: doc_index

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of document.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a docket defendant resource by docket defendant number and case docket number. See clientDocketDefendant. Main data source (database tables): client case_defendant, cases, adjudicatd_offense, sentence.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of clientDocketDefendant.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets the docket defendants in a case. See docketDefendant and docketDefendantBase. Main data source (database tables): case_defendant, adjudicatd_offense, cases, sentence.

wadl:param.name: caseDktNo
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Court docket number for the case including: AO circuit district number, divisional office, year, case type, and docket number. For example, 0090 1:97CR01515.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of docketDefendant instances.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a docket list containing the docket defendant and associated active officer, active supervision, and active intake. If your list is bigger than 500, only the first 500 results are returned. See docket, docketDefendantWithActiveOfficers, and simpleStaffBase. Main data source (database tables): cases, case_defendant, staff.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: (required) One or more key pairs of CaseDktNo and DefendantNo.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing list of docket instances.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a docket defendant resource by case docket number. See clientDocketDefendant. Main data source (database tables): cases, case_defendant, client

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of clientDocketDefendant.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Gets a list of DrugTest and their associated TestSite given a localSpecimen identifier.

DrugTest represents ONE attempt to collect a sample, be it from urine or sweatpatch. TestSite stores data and defaults specific to each testing site (in-house or vendor).

See drugTest and testSite. Main data source (database tables): drug_test, test_site.

wadl:param.name: localSpecimen
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Vendor-supplied specimen number when coc and barcode are not used.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of TestSite.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a document showing the state of the local configuration data for a particular district. This document is a detailed dump of data in the "local" table of the server. See localCircuitDistrictConfiguration.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: Returns a serviceResponse containing an instance of a localCircuitDistrictConfiguration document.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a document listing the pacts user information for a particular district. This document is a detailed dump of data in the "local" table of the server. See localCircuitDistrictConfiguration.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: Returns a serviceResponse containing an instance of a localCircuitDistrictConfiguration document.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of clientcaseaccount by a firsname, lastname, registernumber, casenumber, district, ssn and lcdId. Please note that lcdId and one of the other web parameters are required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appSearchCasesAccountNumber

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of ClientCaseAccount.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of client case info by uid and lcdId. Please note that lcdId and one of the other web parameters are required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetCase

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of ClientCaseInfo.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of clientcases by a firsname, lastname, registernumber, casenumber, district, ssn and lcdId. Please note that lcdId and one of the other web parameters are required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appSearchCases

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of ClientCase.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of debt balances by uid and lcdId. Please note that lcdId and one of the other web parameters are required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetDebtBalances

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of DebtBalance.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of District Offices. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetOfficesByDistrict

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of DistrictOffice.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of all Opera Districts. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetAllDistricts

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaAllDistrict.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets case report from district by year (2-digit year) Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetCaseReport

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaCaseReport.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a list of Opera Districts. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetDistricts

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaDistrict.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets districtId from district abbreviation. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetDistrictId

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaDistrictId.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets value if Opera is loaded for a district. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appIsLoadedDistrict

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaIsLoadedDistrict.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a Opera last load date for district. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetLastLoadDate

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaLastLoadDate.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a Opera last updated date for district. Please note that lcdId is required. Main data source(CCAM database procedures) usp_appGetLastUpdatedDates

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of OperaLastUpdatedDate.

wadl:method.name: GET

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Gets active investigations by officer id and investigation type. See activeInvestigation. Main data source (database tables): investigation, case_defendant, and sentence.

Pass a list of invest types by constructing the URL as follows:
/uspps-rest/postconviction/activeinvestigations?lcdId=0123&officerId=123&investType=PSIG&investType=RETRO

wadl:param.name: investType
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) a list of investTypes (example values include "PSI", "PSIG", "MPSI", "RETRO")

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a list of activeInvestigations.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing pretrial docket defendant resource. Note that the following fields are NOT able to be updated: preTrialInvestigations, pactsCaseNo, oldDfnsAttorney, oldAusaAttorney, docketId, defendantNo, clientId, adjudicationDate. Refer to docketDefendantPretrial.

Minimum required elements: defendantNo, docketId, id, createdOn, createdBy, clientId, and vccaStatus.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a docketDefendantPreTrial XML document. The document should include the id value of the pretrial docket defendant resource to update.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a docketDefendantPreTrial instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Adds a new intake resource to the system. See intake.

Minimum required elements: docketDefendantId, intakeTypeId, createdOn, and createdBy.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a intake XML document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically. Data in the following elements will be ignored: ausaRecommends, bailReportByOfficer, chargingDocument, intakeType, psaRecommends, referralAction and reportType.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a intake instance representing the new resource. The client instance includes the id value.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Updates an existing intake resource. See intake.

Minimum required elements: id and required elements specified in the POST /intake service.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a intake XML document. The document should include the id value of the intake resource to update. Data in the following elements will be ignored: ausaRecommends, bailReportByOfficer, chargingDocument, intakeType, psaRecommends, referralAction and reportType.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a intake instance representing the updated resource.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets a phaseDay and associated phaseType and phaseLocations for a given phase_date range. See phaseDay, phaseType, and phaseLocation The dates are in YYYY-MM-DD format. The range cannot exceed 90 days and defaults to the current date +1 through 90 days after the current date. Minimum required elements: lcdId, id

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a phaseDay and associated phaseType and phaseLocations

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets phaseLocations for a given district. See < phaseLocation Minimum required elements: lcdId

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a phaseDay and associated phaseType and phaseLocations

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets phaseTypes for a given district. See < phaseType Minimum required elements: lcdId

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a phaseDay and associated phaseType and phaseLocations

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets treatment plans associated with a client by clientId, provider Id and termination date. See clientTreatmentPlan. Main data source (database tables): client, provider, treat_plan, treat_plan_det, nctreatplanservice

wadl:param.name: clientId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: System generated unique ide for a defendant/offender

wadl:param.name: providerId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: id associated with provider of the treatment plan (optional)

wadl:param.name: termDate
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The date that all treatment services were terminated for this plan (optional)

wadl:param.name: svcCategoryId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The service category id that the service is designated in Nctreatplanservice table(optional)

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of docketDefendantPretrial.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc: Gets treatment plans associated with a client by clientId, provider Id and termination date. See treatPlan. Main data source (database tables): client, provider, treat_plan, treat_plan_det, nctreatplanservice

wadl:param.name: clientId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: System generated unique ide for a defendant/offender

wadl:param.name: providerId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: id associated with provider of the treatment plan (optional)

wadl:param.name: termDate
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The date that all treatment services were terminated for this plan (optional)

wadl:param.name: svcCategoryId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The service category id that the service is designated in Nctreatplanservice table(optional)

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing an instance of docketDefendantPretrial.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Posts (create) an assessment for a given caseplan. The caseplanId must be provided. See caseplanAssessmentAudit.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan_assessmnt.

The order (sequence) of the elements specified in the XML is critical for the success of this operation. The status values must be supplied in upper case.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a caseplanAssessmentAudit XML or JSON document. The document should include an id value for the caseplanId.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the updated instance of assessment entry for the caseplan.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Puts (update) the assessment information for a given caseplan. The assessment Id must be provided. See caseplanRPIAudit.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan_assessmnt.

The order (sequence) of the elements specified in the XML is critical for the success of this operation.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a caseplanAssessmentAudit XML or JSON document. The document should include an id value for the assessment.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the updated instance of statutory requirements for the caseplan.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Puts (update) the RPI score calculator information for a given caseplan. The rpiId must be provided. See caseplanRPIAudit. The actual RPI score value (1 - ??) must be separately managed as part of the caseplan record.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan_rpi.

The order (sequence) of the elements specified in the XML is critical for the success of this operation. The Y and N flags must be supplied in upper case.

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a caseplanRPI XML or JSON document. The document should include an id value for the RPI.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the updated instance of statutory requirements for the caseplan.

wadl:method.name: POST
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Posts (create) a simple caseplan that is in draft status. Some business validations must be successful for the entry to be created. The following high-level business rules must be satisfied (besides data editing rules):
  • The specified client Id must be valid.
  • Only one caseplan can be in draft status for the selected client.
  • There must be an active supervision entry for the client for creating a caseplan.

A caseplan Id will be generated by the database upon successful creation of the entry. See simpleCaseplanBase, simpleCaseplanAudit.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan, supervisn_caseplan, client, supervision.

The caseplan start date and plan due date will be automatically adjusted based on the information in the active supervision record.

Minimum required elements: caseplanNumber - must be 1, caseplanStatusValue - must be 'draft' without quotes, clientId, fromDate, createdBy (in this order).

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a simpleCaseplanAudit XML or JSON document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the newly created instance of SimpleCaseplanAudit including the generated ID.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Puts (update) a simple caseplan that is in draft or submit status. Once approved, the caseplan may not be altered. Some business validations must be successful for the entry to be created. The following high-level business rules must be satisfied (besides data editing rules):
  • The specified client Id must be valid.
  • Only one caseplan can be in draft (or submit) status for the selected client.
  • There must be an active supervision entry for the client for creating a caseplan.

A caseplan Id must exist in the database for successful update of the entry. See simpleCaseplanBase, simpleCaseplanAudit.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan, supervisn_caseplan, client, supervision.

The caseplan client Id, from date and plan due date may not be modified.

Minimum required elements: caseplanNumber, caseplanStatusValue - must be 'draft' or 'submit' or 'approve' without quotes, clientId, updatedBy (in this order).

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a caseplan XML or JSON document. The document should not include an id value. The id will be assigned automatically.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the updated instance of SimpleCaseplanAudit.

wadl:method.name: PUT
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Posts or Puts (create/update) the statutory requirements data for a given caseplan. The caseplan Id must be provided. See caseplanStatutoryRequirementsAudit.

Main data source (database tables): caseplan_stat_reqs.

The order (sequence) of the elements specified in the XML is critical for the success of this operation.

Minimum required elements: id (caseplan Id), createdBy (in this order).

wadl:request.wadl:doc: The body of the HTTP request must include a caseplan XML or JSON document. The document should include an id value for the caseplan.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing the newly created or updated instance of statutory requirements for the caseplan.

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance(s) of clientDataTransfer. If a receivingLcdId parameter value is specified, only one instance will be returned. Otherwise, one or more instances will be returned.

wadl:method.wadl:doc: Deprecated endpoint -- DO NOT USE.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Search client addresses and/or contacts (phone, fax, email, pager, etc.) for matching user-supplied wild-card fields. The wild-cards must adhere to ANSI SQL LIKE syntax specifications. The searches are case-insensitive with wild-cards. NULL values in the respective columns will match all wild-cards (based on the user option). For performance reasons, there is a hard limit on the maximum number of rows these search functions can return (currently set at 100). The search performance depends on the number of selection criteria that is provided. The more criteria you can provide, the better the search performance.

If a service exception is received, please narrow the search by adding more parameters or by reducing the number of rows to be returned in the result set to reduce the time of execution.

See clientAddress, addressContact, geoAddress, and baseAddress.

wadl:param.name: stateId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: State (two character code) or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: countyId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: County or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: city
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Name of the city or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: address2
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Address line two or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: address1
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Address line one or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactDesc
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact details or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: matchNulls
wadl:param.wadl:doc: should wild-cards match NULL values also? 1 = Yes, 0 = No (default)

wadl:param.name: skipRows
wadl:param.wadl:doc: initial number of entries to be skipped before building result set

wadl:param.name: maxRows
wadl:param.wadl:doc: maximum number of entries in the result set

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing zero or more instances of Client Address.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Search client information data (personal, employment, vehicle and contact records) for matching user-supplied wild-card fields. The wild-cards must adhere to ANSI SQL LIKE syntax specifications. The searches are case-insensitive with wild-cards. NULL values in the respective columns will match all wild-cards (based on the user option). For performance reasons, there is a hard limit on the maximum number of rows these search functions can return (currently set at 100). This is an expensive query. The search performance depends on the number of selection criteria that is provided. The more criteria you can provide, the better the search performance.

If a service exception is received, please narrow the search by adding more parameters or by reducing the number of rows to be returned in the result set to reduce the time of execution.

If the retrieveClientOnly field is set to 1, only the basic client information is retrieved (removing duplicate entries that matched). By setting this value to 0, the matched data along with the client information will be returned which may result in duplicate client information when multiple addresses for the client are matched.

See clientBase, employer, employment, clientEmployment, clientVehicle, clientAddress, addressContact, geoAddress, and baseAddress.

Main data source (database tables): client, race, sex, client_vehicle, client_address, address_contact, contact_type, employment, and employer

wadl:param.name: clientId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Client Id or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: retrieveClientOnly
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Set value to 0 if the complete client information with the matched data should be returned. Defaults to 1 (only basic client information is returned).

wadl:param.name: color
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Color of the vehicle or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: make
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Vehicle make or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: model
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Vehicle model or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: year
wadl:param.wadl:doc: The model year the vehicle or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: licenseTag
wadl:param.wadl:doc: License tag number or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: licenseState
wadl:param.wadl:doc: State that issued the license or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: vin
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Vehicle identification number or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactStateId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact state (two character code) or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactCountyId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact county or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactCity
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact city or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactAddress2
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact address line two or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactAddress1
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact address line one or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: contactDesc
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Contact details or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empStateId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Employer state (two character code) or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empCountyId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Employer county or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empCity
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Employer city or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empAddress2
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Employer address line two or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empAddress1
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Employer address line one or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: jobTitle
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Job Title or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: companyName
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Company name or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empPhone
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Phone number or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: empEmail
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Email Address or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: gender
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Gender of the client being searched. Any single character may be specified. (Unless specified, ignored by default)

wadl:param.name: race
wadl:param.wadl:doc: Race of the client being searched. Any single character may be specified. (Unless specified, ignored by default)

wadl:param.name: ssn
wadl:param.wadl:doc: SSN or wild-card adhering to SQL standards

wadl:param.name: matchNulls
wadl:param.wadl:doc: should wild-cards match NULL values also? 1 = Yes, 0 = No (default)

wadl:param.name: skipRows
wadl:param.wadl:doc: initial number of entries to be skipped before building result set

wadl:param.name: maxRows
wadl:param.wadl:doc: maximum number of entries in the result set

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing zero or more instances of Client.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Gets a list of officer-to-client assignments for a given district, filtered using fileOutLoc from the client table. A value of 06 in column fileOutLoc in client table indicates preassign for MOE

1) fileOutLoc = "06" Preassign for MOE (Probation),

Example: "get all categorized as preassi gn for district 0865 "
https://usppsesb-sand.chnt.gtwy.dcn:8443/upps-rest/district/officer/clientassignment/preassign?lcdId=0865&fileOutLoc=06

Referenced tables: client, staff

Returns a ServiceResponse containing a collection of officer-client assignments. Certain fields such as dates are specific to a certain category and are not returned for all categories. See: officerClientAssignment

wadl:param.name: staffId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) Used to limit the results to a specific officer. Default is all.

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Gets a list of officer-to-client assignments for a given district, filtered using several categories and optional parameters. The categories that may be included in the response are a combination (union) of one or more of the following:

1) "supv" Current Active Supervisions (Probation),
2) "inv_prob_all" Unsubmitted Investigations (Probation),
3) "inv_prob" Recent Investigations (Probation) not in supervision,
4) "inv_pts" Current Investigations (Pretrial),
5) "intake" Recent prisoner intakes (Pretrial) not in investigation,
6) "psupv" Open Pretrial Supervisions (Pretrial),
7) "preassign" Preassign (Probation)

Example: "get all current supervisions, probation investigations, and prisoner intakes for district 9999 where the investigation.due_date or intake.closed_on date is today-30 days"
https://usppsesb-sand.chnt.gtwy.dcn:8443/uspps-rest/district/officer/clientassignment/summary?lcdId=9999&category=supv&category=inv_prob&category=intake&prevDays=30

Referenced tables: client, supervision, psupervision, case_defendant, cases, staff, investigation, intake

Returns a ServiceResponse containing a collection of officer-client assignments. Certain fields such as dates are specific to a certain category and are not returned for all categories. See: officerClientAssignment

wadl:param.name: category
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (required) One or more assignment categories to return

wadl:param.name: prevDays
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) Number of days in the past (category 3 or 5). Default is 30 days.

wadl:param.name: staffId
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) Used to limit the results to a specific officer. Default is all.

wadl:param.name: supvStatus
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) filter Supervisions by current_status. Default is 'AC' (Active).

wadl:param.name: investType
wadl:param.wadl:doc: (optional) filter Probation Investigations by invest_type. Default is all.

wadl:method.name: GET

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing a collection of Staff

wadl:param.name: id

wadl:method.name: GET
wadl:method.wadl:doc:
Get a list of document information using the client id and optional query parameters. This service returns descriptive metadata about documents that exist in PACTS. See documentImage. Results are ordered by date (desc). The docType and caseDefendantId query parameters are optional and can be used to filter the results. Database table: doc_index

Pass a list of doc types by constructing the URL as follows:
/uspps-rest/docimage/info/client/1111?lcdId=AAAA&docType=MSR&docType=NLE&docType=F12C

wadl:param.name: docType
wadl:param.wadl:doc: A list of document types to query for (optional)

wadl:response.wadl:doc: ServiceResponse containing instance of document.
